problem_summary_simple: Count groups of strings that are special-equivalent by swapping even/odd indexed characters.
problem_summary_technical: Groups strings by a canonical representation derived from counts of characters at even and odd indices.
time_complexity: O(N * L), where N is the number of strings and L is the length of each string.
space_complexity: O(N * L) in the worst case, to store the canonical representations in the set.
key_insights: Swapping characters at even indices allows any permutation of even-indexed characters. Similarly for odd indices.
A string's special-equivalence can be determined by the counts of characters at even positions and odd positions separately.
A tuple of these counts serves as a unique identifier for each special-equivalence group.
